game_theory_chaos_exploration.description: Lamar-generated prompts for Tiber to explore game theory and chaos theory applications in fantasy football

scenario.setup: Playoff matchup against rival who mirrors your moves. Both stream QBs/TEs. Waivers lock in 6 hours.
scenario.complication: Opponent picks opposite of whatever you start

analysis_framework.opponent_modeling: Reason through what opponent likely does if also playing game theory
analysis_framework.leveling_strategies: Level 1: play best guy, Level 2: counter best guy, Level 3+: meta-counters
analysis_framework.mind_games: If you think he expects McCarthy, he might take Ridder, opening path to bait him and pivot to Baker
analysis_framework.optimal_redefinition: Sometimes optimal isn't best projection - it's forcing worst-case for opponent

scenario.setup: 12-point lead going into Monday Night Football

chaos_factor.weather: Huge storm rolling into Levi's Stadium
chaos_factor.risk: Kickoff may be delayed or canceled

scenario.safety_option: Bench McCaffrey for Monday night kicker
scenario.decision_point: Risk McCaffrey 10-15 points vs bench for safety net kicker

analysis_framework.butterfly_effects: Small weather change creates massive outcome variance
analysis_framework.chaos_sensitivity: How sensitive is your win probability to external factors
analysis_framework.fragile_vs_antifragile: Building lineups that benefit from chaos vs break from it

user_profile.goal: Win now while avoiding 2026 cliff fall

user_concerns.fear_1: Ekeler dies on roster (aging asset waste)
user_concerns.fear_2: Gibbs might not be tier-jumper (overpay risk)
user_concerns.fear_3: Reputation damage from bad calculated trade

game_theory_elements: Nash equilibrium of aging asset management
Information asymmetry between contenders and rebuilders
Reputation effects on future trade negotiations
meta_considerations: How this trade affects league perception of user strategy
Impact on future trade partner willingness
Signaling effects to other managers about win-now timeline

game_theory: Nash equilibrium concepts in draft strategy
chaos_theory: Pattern recognition in seemingly random performance

tiber_analysis_goals.mathematical_frameworks: Apply formal game theory and chaos theory concepts
tiber_analysis_goals.practical_applications: Connect theory to actionable fantasy decisions
tiber_analysis_goals.meta_strategy: Develop frameworks for strategic thinking about strategic thinking
